Rulings.Base:
1. The effect to negate a Spell/Trap Card can be activated during the Damage Step.
2. It can be activated during each player's turn.
3. If this card is no longer face-up on the field when the effect to negate a Spell/Trap Card resolves, the Spell/Trap Card is still negated.
4. If this card is attacked while face-down and would be destroyed by the battle, you can destroy another face-up 'Six Samurai' monster you control instead.
5. [FORUM] The effect of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" can only be activated once per turn. Switching control of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" from one player to another will not change the fact that the effect of this face-up monster has already been activated.
6. [FORUM] "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" cannot destroy another 'Six Samurai' monster that is also marked for destruction to save itself.

EXAMPLE 1: Player A controls "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" and 2 other 'Six Samurai' monsters. Player B plays "Dark Hole". Player A would not be able to destroy one of the other 2 'Six Samurai' monsters he controls instead of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" since all monsters are marked for destruction.

EXAMPLE 2: Player A controls "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" and summons another 'Six Samurai' monster. Player B responds to the Summon with "Torrential Tribute". Player A would not be able to destroy the other 'Six Samurai' monster he Summoned instead of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" since all monsters are marked for destruction.

PSCT.Base:
1 Warrior Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner "Six Samurai" monsters
Once per turn, when your opponent activates a Spell/Trap Card (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it. If this card on the field would be destroyed by battle or card effect, you can destroy another "Six Samurai" monster you control instead.
